claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

verified_snippets.quote: Each0.5mLdoseof Flublokmayalsocontainresidual amountsof baculovirus andSpodopterafrugiperdacell proteins (≤14.3mcg), baculovirus andcellular DNA(≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg).
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote provides supporting evidence that baculovirus and insect cell components are present in the final product, which is consistent with the use of a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) in insect cells for production.
verified_snippets.context: A single 0.5 mL dose of Flublok contains sodium chloride (4.4 mg), monobasic sodium phosphate (0.2 mg), dibasic sodiumphosphate (0.5 mg), and polysorbate 20 (Tween®20) (27.5mcg). Each0.5mLdoseof Flublokmayalsocontainresidual amountsof baculovirus andSpodopterafrugiperdacell proteins (≤14.3mcg), baculovirus andcellular DNA(≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg). Flublok contains no egg proteins, antibiotics, or preservatives.

verified_snippets.quote: FlublokQuadrivalent is relevant to Flublok because both nes are manufactured using the same process and have overlapping compositions.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote clarifies that Flublok and Flublok Quadrivalent are produced using the same manufacturing process, which is described elsewhere as involving recombinant HA expression in insect cells using a baculovirus vector. This supports the generalizability of the production platform described for Flublok.
verified_snippets.context: safety experience with Flublok Quadrivalent is relevant to Flublok because both nes are manufactured using the same process and have overlapping compositions.

verified_snippets.quote: 2. Baxter R, Patriarca PA, Ensor K, et al. Evaluation of the safety, reactogenicity and mmunogenicity of FluBlok trivalent recombinant baculovirus-expressed hemagglutinin nfluenza vaccine administered intramuscularly to healthy adults 50-64 years of age. Vaccine. 2011, Vol. 29, pp. 2272-2278.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This reference title explicitly states that Flublok is a 'recombinant baculovirus-expressed hemagglutinin influenza vaccine,' directly supporting the claim that the HA is expressed using a baculovirus system.
